summary: Louis H Hindle is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1979. These documents detail his position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The consistent appearance of his name across these reports indicates his sustained employment with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Louis H Hindle's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
